page.title: 05Census studies in Wytham
page.content: According to the figures for the 1981 census Wytham had a population of 152 people. Since 1943 when the village became a University property, the population has declined. In 1881, the census recorded 271 inhabitants. In the last 100 years there has been a decrease of 40%. In 1881 there were 91 males, 107 females and 73 children. In 1981 there were 78 males, 73 females and 19 children. The noticeable change is in the number of children in the village. In 1881, 37% of the population was employed in various ways. In 1981 39% were at work. More than 20% of the population was of pensionable age. The present village of Wytham has a relatively old population with very few youngsters under the age of 16.
